titleStmt.title: Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus" / Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" / ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... "Does not the man..."

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist in Text I; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts II-1, II-2, II-4 and III; incipit of Texts IV; one or two initial lines of sections of Texts I, II-2, II-3, II-4, III; section numbers of Texts II-4 and III, first character of the word sälam in Text II-1 (fol. 10rb), first word (or parts of it) of the strophes of Text II-5 and IV; elements of the punctuation signs and the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.note: Text I-1b concludes with an ʾarke-hymn:
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 13rb-va) (cp. ChRep no. 373)

- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam qǝddǝst dǝngǝl ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 13va-14ra).
The miracles of Mary (Text II-4) are numbered. The texts ends suddenly, leaving the last miracle incomplete.
Text II-5 comprises 5 strophes which are strophes 1-5 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53.

The miracles of Jesus (Text III) are erroneously numbered. The scribe included parts of the introduction in numbering the miracles; these sections were introduced as mǝʿǝraf “chapter” (numbered as 2-3). The first actual miracle starts at the end of "chapter" 3 and is part of "chapter" 4. The sections numbered as 8, 13 and 14 are parts of the preceding miracles (8 is part of the 4th miracle, 13 and 14 are parts of the 8th miracle).
Text IV comprises 34 strophes which are strophes 1-31, 33-34 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53 and one additional (fol. 149vb-vc):
አፍጠኒተ፡ ረድኤት፡ ማርያም፡ በጊዜ፡ ምንዳቤ፡ ወዓፀባ።
አንቲ፡ ውእቱ፡ ረዳኢተ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ በቤተ፡ ሳባ።

list.item: 3 I(3; s.l.: 1, stub after stub of 2; 2, stub after 2; {3}, no stub/fols. 1r-3v)
8 X(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 60r-67v)
8 XII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 76r-83v)

2 XXI(2; s.l.: 1, stub after stub of 2; 2, stub after 2/fols. 149r-150v)
Fol. 3 is sewn with parchments strips onto the stub of fol. 1.

supportDesc.condition:
The Ms. shows traces of extensive use. The Ms. was rebound. The front board has been attached to the textblock in reversed position (previous set of holes are visible at the outer edge). Both borads are broken and repaired. The full leather cover is torn off; remains are preserved on the back board; traces of leather and adhesive are visible on the inner side of both boards. The overback is damaged at the spine and roughly repaired; its turns-ins are nailed on the front board. Holes or tears amended on fols. 2, 4, 26, 29, 34, 129. Fol. 150 is mutilated, cut at the upper margin. Some fols. are affected by humidity (fols. 130r-136v).
The Ms. consists of at least 4 production units: - Fol. 3 originates from a different codex; it was cut to the size of this Ms. and sewn onto the stub of the endleaf (fol. 1). - Quires II and III originate from different codices. - It seems likely that quires IV-XV as well as quires XVI- XXI (all written in hand a) were originally included into two separate codices and at a later stage bound together (cp. donors, ruling pattern and palaeographic features).

layout.note: Quire II: all data for fol. 5r.

The bottom line is written above the ruling.

The bottom line is written above the ruling.

The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on fols. 22rv, 25rv.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Quires XVI-XI: all data for fol. 111r.
layout.ab: Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (sometimes carelessly executed, e.g., fols. 113v, 119rv, 121rv, 125rv, 132rv, 134rv: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B or fol. 130rv: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A).
The upper line is written above the ruling
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.ab: Hand a: irregular. Hand b: mediocre, uneven. Hand c: mediocre.
handNote.seg: Black, red (hand a: strong red in quires IV-XV, vivid red in quires XVI-XXI; hand b: strong crimson, hand c: vivid red).
handNote.date: Hand a: First half of the 18th cent. (?) Hand b: 20th century (?) Hand c: First half of the 18th cent. (?)

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: Texts I-a, II-2, II-3, II-4, II-5, III, IV (fol. 3, quires IV-XXI). The handwriting appears irregular throughout the Ms. and changes from careful and neat with broadly spaced letters (quires IV-XV), occasionally in smaller script (fols. 68r-69v, 74r-75v), to mediocre resulting in an uneven script (due to the irregular ruled lines) with narrowly spaced letters (quires XVII-XXI). The quality of rubricated passages also differs (cp. 28v, 68v); often the space left for the name of Mary was not sufficient (cp. 17r, 42v, 68vc, 74vc). Probably the texts were written at several (three?) stages.
However, it shows a few distinctive features throughout all quires:

- the mark of the 6th vowel order in ክ is sometimes not executed or barely visible (cp. fol. 13ra l. 11, in the names of the donors ርቱዕ፡ አምላክ፡ (fols. 12ra, 14vb, passim) or ዘክርስቶስ፡ (fols. 29rc, 37rb passim), in the name of ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ (fols. 110ra, 115rb, passim).
Hand b: Text I-b = quire II.
Hand c: Text II-1 = quire III. The character ሥ is of particular shape (s. fol. 8rb l. 8, 8va l. 6).

list.item:
Fol. 109vc-vb: Excerpt from Säʿatat zä-lelit "Horologium for the Night".Fol. 109vc: ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጥዑመ፡ ስም፡ ለዘይጼውኦ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በግዓ፡ መድሐኒት፡ ለዘይሰውዖ፡ ከመ፡ ይባርኩነ፡ ይፈኑ፡ አርዳኦ፡ ለጸባኢነ፡ ይጽብዖ፡ ወልታሁ፡ ነሲኦ። ...
Rubrication has been executed with brown ink.

- An extensive passage has been erased from fol. 11ra-rb. - Faded recent ownership note mentioning Däbrä Mäʿar, in pencil: fol. 11v. - Erased note (previously rubricated): fol. 25r (bottom margin). - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 24rb, 40va, 41ra, 110rc, 116vb, 122rab, 142rc. - Omitted words or additions written interlineally: fols. 8ra-9rb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 9rb, 10vb, 91vb. - Writing exercise, scribbles: fols. 52ra, 150r. - Very crude recent ownership note in pen, Gǝʿǝz with admixture of Amharic and Tǝgrǝñña (repeated twice): fol. 150v, ዘመጽሐፍ፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኡናማ፡ እጾ፡ ተፅህፈ፡ በአስራ፡ በ፲፱፻፴፡ አመተ፡ መህረት። - Crude notes, in pencil: fol. 1v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (both boards broken and repaired), previously covered with dark brown tooled leather (remains are preserved on the back board). Overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Traces of a chain of endband stitches at the spine cover, close to the head of the codex. Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the tail of the codex.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (1 tool was used: single line fillet).

origin.origDate: Quires IV-XXI: first half of the 18th cent. (?) Fol. 3 was added at a later stage. Since it is written in the main hand (hand a), it must have been produced at around the same time as the main body of the textblock. Quire II is of more recent time (20th cent.?). Quire III may be dated to the 18th cent., along with the main body of the textblock.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Rǝtuʿǝ ʾAmlak and sometimes Zä-Krǝstos are mentioned in supplication formulas throughout fols. 12ra-89vc, in hand a. It seems that another name has been erased at the beginning of the main textblock (cp. fols. 16vb, 17ra); the name (or parts) of Rǝtuʿǝ ʾAmlak was sometimes written over erasures (cp. fols. 16ra, 16va, 17va-19ra). The names of Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb and Wäldä Giyorgis are written in supplication formulas on fols. 82rv, 90vc-108vb. In quires XVI-XX, Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb and Ker ʾƎgziʾ (e.g., fols. 115rb, 117ra, 120rb, 123vc, 129ra, 141rb) as well as Gädä Krǝstos and Kǝflä Giyorgis (e.g., fols. 115rc, 121vc, 125rb, 132vb, 141rc) are mentioned in the supplication formulas. The name of Maḫdärä Krǝstos is written in the supplication formula on fol. 11ra, in hand c.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
